Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of a dog. A Sothic dog, ears erect above the face; face elongated towards muzzle. Mould-made and hollow. Fur is crudely indicated with impressed slashes. Organic red-brown Nile silt. Most of base and part of back is lost.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Sothic dog with Roman parallel in the Louvre (Dunand 1990, no. 871). Representation of the Dog Star, Sirius, associated with Isis. Dunand, F. 1990, Musée du Louvre. Département des antiquités égyptiennes. Catalogue des terres cuites grécoromaines d'Egypte, Paris.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.191) (Phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4583 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
